batch

Class BatchExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • batch.BatchExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Batchable, java.lang.Iterable<MediaFile>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BatchConsole

    public class BatchExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Batchable, java.lang.Iterable<MediaFile>
    Automates the batch processing of image files by copying, renaming, and chronologically sorting them based on their EXIF metadata, such as DateTimeOriginal.

    This class supports a range of image formats, including JPEG, TIFF, PNG, WebP, and HEIF. If EXIF metadata is not available, it defaults to using the file's last modified time-stamp.

    To access the sorted list of files, use the Iterable<MediaFile> interface.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      • createImageVisitor

        private java.nio.file.FileVisitor<java.nio.file.Path> createImageVisitor()
        Creates and returns a FileVisitor instance to traverse the source directory.

        This visitor extracts and analyses metadata from each file, such as the EXIF DateTimeOriginal tag. Files with relevant metadata are wrapped in a MediaFile object and added to the internal sorted set.

        Returns:
        a configured FileVisitor for processing image files

      • startLogging

        private void startLogging()
                   throws BatchErrorException
        Begins the logging system and writes initial configuration details to a log file. This method is for internal setup and is not intended for external use.
        Throws:
        BatchErrorException - if the logging service cannot be set up

      • extractExifDate

        private static java.util.Date extractExifDate(MetadataTIF tif)
        Extracts the date from EXIF metadata in a MetadataTIF object.
        Parameters:
        tif - the MetadataTIF instance
        Returns:
        a Date object from the EXIF data, or null if not found

      • extractPngDate

        private static java.util.Date extractPngDate(MetadataPNG<?> png)
        Extracts the date from PNG metadata. It first checks for embedded EXIF data, then falls back to textual chunks if available.
        Parameters:
        png - the MetadataPNG instance
        Returns:
        a Date object from the PNG data, or null if not found

      • updateAndCopyFiles

        public void updateAndCopyFiles()
                        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Executes the batch copying process. To be sub-classed to provide an accurate implementation.

        This method iterates through the internal sorted set of MediaFile objects and copies each source file to the target directory. It renames the copied file using the designated prefix and updates its file time attributes (creation, last modified, and last access) to match the "Date Taken" timestamp determined during the scan phase.

        Specified by:
        updateAndCopyFiles in interface Batchable
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException
